title: Knapp Lake
text:
Knapp Lake is a small natural <a href="lake">lake</a> located in western <a href="Noble%20County%2C%20Indiana">Noble County</a>, <a href="Indiana">Indiana</a>.
Knapp Lake is directly attached to Little Bause Lake via a <a href="channel%20%28geography%29">channel</a> and Little Knapp Lake on the south and southwest and Moss Lake to the north. Little Bause has development around its shores while Little Knapp is undeveloped. <a href="Harper%20Lake%20%28Indiana%29">Harper Lake</a> and <a href="Gilbert%20Lake">Gilbert Lake</a>, both undeveloped for the most part form the southern part of the <a href="Papakeechie%20watershed">Papakeechie watershed</a> as it flows northward to <a href="Lake%20Wawasee">Lake Wawasee</a> through Moss Lake.
The southwest, northeast and north shores comprise the bulk of the homes on the lake. The north shore has five man-made channels. The northwest shore is forested. <a href="Arable%20land">Farmland</a> surrounds mostly the east and south beyond inhabited areas.
In 1999, with the assistance of the Indiana Department of Natural Resources, the Wawasee Property Owners Association purchased of land and <a href="wetland">wetland</a>s on Knapp Lake and surrounding Little Knapp Lake.
